guide: Explore my education, experience, projects, and more below — or follow my journey via the 'See My Journey' button in the intro.
guide2: Find some of my favorite shows, games, and hacks in the 'Know Me More' section.
entertainment: I love watching anime, web series, K-dramas, and movies, and I often play mobile games.
art: I'm into football and chess. As a kid, I loved drawing and painting — and I can still sketch a bit.
music: I listen to music whenever it feels too quiet (check out my Spotify playlist in the 'Know Me More' section).
travel: I'm not a big traveler, but I love meeting new people and spending time with friends — they make any trip worth it.
other: I enjoy organizing things (maybe a little OCD). Hufff… I guess that's already a lot. A long-short summary, if you will.
quotes: Life's too short for bad Wi-Fi
Chasing 100% on every detail… even if no one notices
Don't grow up, it's a trap
Stuff's organized, life's still a little wild
Opportunities don't happen, you create them
I pause life for a few episodes of anime
Sarcasm: just one of my many non-talents
Master of Fixing One Thing and Breaking Two

details: Living the American dream (and surviving Midwest winters)
Still figuring out how to pronounce 'Lafayette'

education.school: IIT Roorkee - Śramam vinā na kimapi sādhyam
details: Survived 4 years of engineering life (and the bland mess food)
Witness to the grandeur of James Thomason Building
Proud alumnus of one of India's oldest (178 yrs apparently) and most prestigious institutes

experience.title: Graduate Research Assistant
experience.description: Working on developing a software for gait analysis using the AMTS forceplates.

experience.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant
experience.description: Developed a Gen AI-based app for mental health pre-assessments, utilizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to gather and summarize relevant data for assisting a scholar's research. Implemented a Streamlit interface with efficient data collection using models like Salesforce Blip and Tesseract OCR. Integrated FAISS to enhance the RAG process and deployed a Mistral LLM locally for assessment functionalities

experience.title: Software Developer Intern
experience.description: Collaborated with the backend team to add new services, decouple the code, and create interfaces for a seamless transition between Azure and Amazon Web Services in the production code reducing the latency by 12%. Worked on backend development using the Gin framework (Golang) and crafted CLI tools with the Cobra framework (Golang), adhering to the production-quality standards of the code. Also learned that production code is like cooking - everyone has an opinion!
